title: &:Seven Poems III
first_line: Spring is like a perhaps hand
text:
Spring is like a perhaps hand
(which comes carefully
out of Nowhere)arranging
a window,into which people look(while
people stare arranging and changing placing
carefully there a strange
thing and a known thing here)and

changing everything carefully

spring is like a perhaps
Hand in a window
(carefully to
and fro moving New and
Old things,while
people stare carefully
moving a perhaps
fraction of flower here placing
an inch of air there)and

without breaking anything.
description: Spring is like a perhaps hand
seo_title: Spring is like a perhaps hand
seo_description: A poem by E. E. Cummings in “&”
